results.title: Drummer Hoff (K)
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios, William Snyder, Morton Schindel and Gene Deitch
results.brief_description: This film is a lively folk verse about the building of a cannon called the Sultan. Brightly dressed in full uniform, each soldier brings a part of the remarkable machine. Based on the book by Barbara and Ed Emberly.

results.title: Drugs: The Children are choosing - The Need for dialogue
results.creator_credit: Joanne M Mock and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Drugs: the children are choosing”.
Reports on a conference in which students and teachers have difficulties in communicating about drugs. Finally the frustrations and problems childhood emerge and it is suggested that it is no wonder young people turn to drugs for escape and pleasure.

results.title: Drugs: it's up to you really
results.creator_credit: Telefeatures, South Australian Film Corporation, Lesley Hammond, Nicholas Cockram and Geoffrey Nottage
results.brief_description: Groups of students talk about their own experiences with drugs, their attitudes towards drugs and the influences upon them to take various drugs especially cigarettes, alcohol and analgesics. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Drugs: a primary film
results.brief_description: Presents vignettes of situations familiar to children to explore the correct use of drugs by the doctor and at home. Reveals the danger of drug misuse and emphasises the positive attitudes needed for a rich and healthy life. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Drugs, use or abuse
results.brief_description: Beginning with various types of beneficial drugs, the film moves to excessive use, stimulants and depressants, damaging chemicals in drugs, psychological dependence and forms of harmful drugs. Presents basic information about drugs and moves the viewer towards their own conclusion.

results.title: Drugs in our time
results.creator_credit: Joanne M Mock and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Drugs: the children are choosing”.
The first film in the series looks at the socioeconomic setting of drug abuse. Seeks reasons for rising use of drugs among young people, and concludes that children are making choices and it is up to adults to prepare them for this.
